J., Rijnhart, J. J., Smyth, H. L., Muniz, F. B., & MacKinnon, D. P. (2020). Causal Mediation Programs R, M plus, SAS, SPSS, Stata. Structural Equation Modeling. DOI: 10.1080/10705511.2020.1777133Article provides overview various computer programs conduct causal mediation analysis. article draws comparisons programs highlights strengths weaknesses . Finds many software packages Mplus R better handling missing data. Mplus preferred variables represent latent variables.Tingley, D., Yamamoto, T., Hirose, K., Keele, L., Imai, K. (2014). Mediation: R package causal mediation analysis. Journal Statistical Software, 59(5).Provides overview description R package conduct causal mediation analysis using model-based design-based approaches described Imai.

heading: 6.2 Websites
text: https://www.publichealth.columbia.edu/research/population-health-methods/causal-mediationWebsite Columbia University Mailman School Public health. Provides brief overview list additional readings potential courses.https://www.hsph.harvard.edu/tyler-vanderweele/tools--tutorials/Tyler VanderWeele website provides additional tools tutorials conducting sensitivity analysis unmeasured confounding (e-values), tools power analysis, links online courses.https://imai.fas.harvard.edu/projects/mechanisms.htmlKosuke Imai’s website providing list publications links presentations statistical software conduct mediation analysis using Imai’s approach R.
